critique: The document is an executive order regarding the status of General Accounting Office employees appointed before July 1, 1935. It allows these employees to acquire competitive classified civil-service status under certain conditions, such as continuous satisfactory service, qualifying in noncompetitive tests, and being citizens of the United States. The order also states that all positions affected by it shall be classified civil-service positions, and vacancies shall be filled according to competitive civil-service requirements.
